channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Oil Prices Rise on Chinese Demand Optimism
item.description: Oil rose with optimism boosted by Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s annual New Year’s address in which he said the country is on an upward trajectory.

item.title: Gold Futures Rise, Starting 2025 on Positive Note
item.description: Gold futures rose, beginning the new year on a positive note, as investors await fresh catalysts to decide the direction of precious metals.

item.title: I’m the executor of my 90-year-old aunt’s estate. A neighbor threatened me and wants to buy her house. What should I do?
item.description: “I believe she doesn’t have that much time left.”

item.title: These are the most popular Moneyist columns of 2024
item.description: Divorce, student debt, airline travel, house purchase and inheritance comprised the top 5 most read columns of the year.

item.title: Sterling Extends Losses Against Dollar After U.K. PMI Data
item.description: Sterling extended losses versus the dollar after a key measure of U.K. manufacturing activity was revised down further into contractionary territory.

item.title: The stock market rarely scores hat tricks. This strategist fears what’s next.
item.description: The S&P 500 has managed two consecutive 20%-plus years in a row, but that has rarely led to a third great year, says this strategist.

item.title: Stock Futures Rise to Start New Year
item.description: Technology stocks were leading gains in premarket trading, with chip stocks and cryptocurrency-linked names rising.

item.title: ‘He ended up homeless and penniless’: My uncle conned my father into signing over their mother’s house. What can I do?
item.description: “His brother went to the prison where my dad was incarcerated and had him sign over the house.”

item.title: Here’s the 2025 surprise that could cause a 10% to 15% stock correction
item.description: Strategist Jim Paulsen says the economic backdrop is pointing to a slowdown in 2025 and this could drive down stocks.

item.title: Big Retail Gets Bigger as Smaller Players Struggle
item.description: Walmart, Amazon and Costco are growing faster than the rest of retail and investing to stay ahead.
